text: Crassispira hanleyi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pseudomelatomidae. ==Description== The length of the shell attains 10 mm This subacuminate, black shell is known by the fine costae, continued nearly to the base and the infrasutural keel.Carpenter P.P. (1857) - Catalogue of the collection of Mazatlan shells in the British Museum, collected by Frederick Reigen ==Distribution== This species occurs in the Pacific Ocean from Mazatlan, Mexico to Nicaragua ==References== ==External links== * hanleyi Category:Gastropods described in 1857
title: Crassispira hanleyi
